message: While the Indian government may have touted great economic impacts of demonetization and GST that would help India move forward, many economists were not convinced. Once such economist predicted the pain that demonetization would cause, and his predictions for the future look just as bleak. Read on to find out more.

Business Club, IIT Kharagpur, is proud to announce our tradition of a podium finish at Techniche lives on for another year. Our members Palak Harwani, Puneet Pansari and Aman Sharma bagged the second place in the case study competition at Techniche, IIT Guwahati. We congratulate them for achieving this feat.

Westeros may be a fictional world, but its economics could have been very plausible just a few centuries ago. With a dynamic world, containing powerful institutions and wealthy families, Game of Thrones has an economy that draws a parallel to our own. Read on to find out more.

Parle-G has been the "family biscuit” of every other Indian household, since the 1940s. Have you ever wondered how the initial days of the indigenous biscuit brand were like? Take a walk back in time to find more about how Parle grew from a small cattle shed to become one of the biggest FMCG players in the Indian market.

https://yourstory.com/2017/08/parle-g-biscuits-swadeshi-movement/?utm_source=FB&utm_medium=Post

We at Business Club, IIT Kharagpur, would like to extend a warm welcome to all the incoming freshers. College is an important milestone and we wish you all the very best as you take your first steps in this journey. You will be presented with an array of opportunities and experiences along the way, make sure you make the best of them!

A leader is the one who knows the way, goes the way and shows the way. We are proud to present the team of Business Club, IIT Kharagpur for the academic year 2017-2018.
We would like to thank our outgoing batch for their invaluable guidance and we assure them we will take the club to greater heights.
story: Business Club, IIT Kharagpur added 10 new photos — with Harsh Agarwal and 9 others.

message: Last November’s demonetisation wasn’t the first currency struggle that mankind has faced. People have faced currency shortages even in the 1970s but back then, the Irish devised an innovative currency partly based on trust. Confused? Read on to find out about a beautiful form of ancient currency followed by an explanation of the solution that the Irish came up with.

Last November’s demonetisation wasn’t the first currency struggle that mankind has faced. People have faced currency shortages even in the 1970s but back then, the Irish devised an innovative currency partly based on trust. Confused? Read on to find out about a beautiful form of ancient currency followed by an explanation of the solution that the Irish came up with.

Tinder may seem like a simple tool with primitive ruling functions that we look up to, when we want to lose the ‘single’ status. But did you know that Tinder functions more like a free market with the same complex psychological and physical decision-making practices? In fact, it may be operating even better than today’s average market economy. Interested? We bet you are!
